meta.title: disable SB (Safe Browsing)

meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>Security>... "Block dangerous downloads"
meta.description: This is the master switch for the safebrowsing.downloads* prefs (0403, 0404)
meta.title: disable SB checks for downloads (both local lookups + remote)

meta.SETUP-SECURITY: If you do not understand this, or you want this protection, then override this
meta.description:
To verify the safety of certain executable files, Firefox may submit some information about the
file, including the name, origin, size and a cryptographic hash of the contents, to the Google
Safe Browsing service which helps Firefox determine whether or not the file should be blocked
meta.title: disable SB checks for downloads (remote)

meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>Security>... "Warn you about unwanted and uncommon software"
meta.title: disable SB checks for unwanted software

meta.description: If clicked, it bypasses the block for that session. This is a means for admins to enforce SB
meta.title: disable "ignore this warning" on SB warnings [FF45+]

meta.description:
SB has taken many steps to preserve privacy. If required, a full url is never sent
to Google, only a part-hash of the prefix, hidden with noise of other real part-hashes.
Firefox takes measures such as stripping out identifying parameters and since SBv4 (FF57+)
doesn't even use cookies. (#Turn on browser.safebrowsing.debug to monitor this activity)

redraw timing attacks were largely mitigated in FF77+ [3]. Using RFP (4501) further hampers timing
attacks. Don't forget clearing history on exit (2811). However, social engineering [2#limits][4][5]
and advanced targeted timing attacks could still produce usable results

URL shortcuts use a cached randomly named .ico file which is stored in your

meta.title: DISK AVOIDANCE

meta.SETUP-WEB: SSL_ERROR_UNSAFE_NEGOTIATION: is it worth overriding this for that one site?
meta.STATS: SSL Labs (May 2024) reports over 99.7% of top sites have secure renegotiation [4]
meta.description:
Blocks connections to servers that don't support RFC 5746 [2] as they're potentially vulnerable to a
MiTM attack [3]. A server without RFC 5746 can be safe from the attack if it disables renegotiations
but the problem is that the browser can't know that. Setting this pref to true is the only way for the
browser to ensure there will be no unsafe renegotiations on the channel between the browser and the server
meta.title: require safe negotiation

meta.description:
This data is not forward secret, as it is encrypted solely under keys derived using
the offered PSK. There are no guarantees of non-replay between connections
meta.title: disable TLS1.3 0-RTT (round-trip time) [FF51+]

meta.NOTE: This pref only controls OCSP fetching and does not affect OCSP stapling
meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>Security>Certificates>Query OCSP responder servers...
meta.description:
0=disabled, 1=enabled (default), 2=enabled for EV certificates only
OCSP (non-stapled) leaks information about the sites you visit to the CA (cert authority)
It's a trade-off between security (checking) and privacy (leaking info to the CA)
meta.title: enforce OCSP fetching to confirm current validity of certificates

meta.description:
When a CA cannot be reached to validate a cert, Firefox just continues the connection (=soft-fail)
Setting this pref to true tells Firefox to instead terminate the connection (=hard-fail)
It is pointless to soft-fail when an OCSP fetch fails: you cannot confirm a cert is still valid (it
could have been revoked) and/or you could be under attack (e.g. malicious blocking of OCSP servers)
meta.title: set OCSP fetch failures (non-stapled, see 1211) to hard-fail

meta.description: 0=disabled, 1=allow user MiTM (default; such as your antivirus), 2=strict
meta.title: enable strict PKP (Public Key Pinning)

meta.description:
0 = disabled
1 = consult CRLite but only collect telemetry
2 = consult CRLite and enforce both "Revoked" and "Not Revoked" results
3 = consult CRLite and enforce "Not Revoked" results, but defer to OCSP for "Revoked" (default)
meta.title: enable CRLite [FF73+]
disable insecure passive content (such as images) on https pages

meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>HTTPS-Only Mode (and manage exceptions)
meta.description: When the top-level is HTTPS, insecure subresources are also upgraded (silent fail)
meta.title: enable HTTPS-Only mode in all windows
enable HTTPS-Only mode for local resources [FF77+]

meta.description:
When attempting to upgrade, if the server doesn't respond within 3 seconds, Firefox sends
a top-level HTTP request without path in order to check if the server supports HTTPS or not
This is done to avoid waiting for a timeout which takes 90 seconds
meta.title: disable HTTP background requests [FF82+]

meta.description: Bug: warning padlock not indicated for subresources on a secure page! [2]
meta.title: display warning on the padlock for "broken security" (if 1201 is false)

meta.description:
only works when it's possible to add an exception
i.e. it doesn't work for HSTS discrepancies (https://subdomain.preloaded-hsts.badssl.com/)
meta.title: display advanced information on Insecure Connection warning pages

meta.description: Your cipher and other settings can be used in server side fingerprinting

This setting controls if the option "Display in Firefox" is available in the setting below
  and by effect controls whether PDFs are handled in-browser or externally ("Ask" or "Open With")

  It maintains disk avoidance and application data isolation. It's convenient. You can still save to disk.
meta.title: enforce PDFJS, disable PDFJS scripting
disable middle click on new tab button opening URLs or searches using clipboard [FF115+] */

meta.description:
DLP agents are background processes on managed computers that allow enterprises to monitor locally running
applications for data exfiltration events, which they can allow/block based on customer defined DLP policies.
0=Block all requests, 1=Warn on all requests (which lets the user decide), 2=Allow all requests
meta.title: disable content analysis by DLP (Data Loss Prevention) agents

meta.title: SHUTDOWN & SANITIZING

meta.NOTE: In FF119+, FPP for all modes (7016) is enabled with ETP Strict (2701)
meta.title: enable FPP in PB mode [FF114+]

meta.NOTE: Not supported by arkenfox. Either use RFP or FPP at defaults
meta.description:
uses "RFPTargets" [1] which despite the name these are not used by RFP
e.g. "+AllTargets,-CSSPrefersColorScheme,-JSDateTimeUTC" = all targets but allow prefers-color-scheme and do not change timezone
e.g. "-AllTargets,+CanvasRandomization,+JSDateTimeUTC" = no targets but do use FPP canvas and change timezone
meta.title: set global FPP overrides [FF114+]

meta.NOTE: Not supported by arkenfox. Either use RFP or FPP at defaults
meta.description: JSON format: e.g."[{\"firstPartyDomain\": \"netflix.com\", \"overrides\": \"-CanvasRandomization,-FrameRate,\"}]"
meta.title: set granular FPP overrides

meta.NOTE: RFPTargets + granular overrides are somewhat experimental and may produce unexpected results
meta.description:
RFP (4501) overrides FPP

In FF118+ FPP is on by default in private windows (4001) and in FF119+ is controlled
by ETP (2701). FPP will also use Remote Services in future to relax FPP protections
on a per site basis for compatibility (4004).

https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/resistfingerprinting/RFPTargetsDefault.inc

- e.g. FrameRate can only be controlled per process, not per origin

1826408 - restrict fonts to system (kBaseFonts + kLangPackFonts) (Windows, Mac, some Linux)
https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/search?path=StandardFonts*.inc
1858181 - subtly randomize canvas per eTLD+1, per session and per window-mode (FF120+)

meta.SETUP-WEB: This is independent of RFP (4501). If you're not using RFP, or you are but
meta.WARNING: DO NOT USE: the dimension pref is only meant for testing
meta.description:
Dynamically resizes the inner window by applying margins in stepped ranges [2]
If you use the dimension pref, then it will only apply those resolutions.
The format is "width1xheight1, width2xheight2, ..." (e.g. "800x600, 1000x1000")
dislike the margins, then flip this pref, keeping in mind that it is effectively fingerprintable

meta.NOTE: Working examples: "arkenfox.github.io", "*github.io"
meta.description: Non-working examples: "https://arkenfox.github.io", "github.io", "*arkenfox.github.io"

meta.description: 0=prompt, 1=disabled, 2=enabled

meta.SETTING: General>Language and Appearance>Fonts and Colors>Colors>Use system colors
meta.title: disable using system colors

meta.SETTING: General>Tabs>Open links in tabs instead of new windows
meta.description:
1=most recent window or tab, 2=new window, 3=new tab
Stops malicious window sizes and some screen resolution leaks.
You can still right-click a link and open in a new window
meta.title: enforce links targeting new windows to open in a new tab instead
set all open window methods to abide by "browser.link.open_newwindow" (4512)

meta.WARNING: DO NOT USE extensions to alter RFP protected metrics
meta.description:
RFP overrides FPP (4000)

FF128+ Arkenfox by default uses FPP (automatically enabled with ETP Strict). For most people
this is all you need. To use RFP instead, add RFP (4501) to your overrides, and optionally
add letterboxing (4504), spoof_english (4506), and webgl (4520).

RFP is an all-or-nothing buy in: you cannot pick and choose what parts you want


418986 - limit window.screen & CSS media queries (FF41)
1360039 - spoof navigator.hardwareConcurrency as 2 (FF55)
FF56
1333651 - spoof User Agent & Navigator API
version: android version spoofed as ESR (FF119 or lower)
OS: JS spoofed as Windows 10, OS 10.15, Android 10, or Linux | HTTP Headers spoofed as Windows or Android
1369319 - disable device sensor API
1369357 - disable site specific zoom
1337161 - hide gamepads from content
1372072 - spoof network information API as "unknown" when dom.netinfo.enabled = true
1333641 - reduce fingerprinting in WebSpeech API
FF57
1369309 - spoof media statistics
1382499 - reduce screen co-ordinate fingerprinting in Touch API
1217290 & 1409677 - enable some fingerprinting resistance for WebGL
1354633 - limit MediaError.message to a whitelist
FF58+
1372073 - spoof/block fingerprinting in MediaDevices API (FF59)
Spoof: enumerate devices as one "Internal Camera" and one "Internal Microphone"
Block: suppresses the ondevicechange event
1039069 - warn when language prefs are not set to "en*" (FF59)
1222285 & 1433592 - spoof keyboard events and suppress keyboard modifier events (FF59)
Spoofing mimics the content language of the document. Currently it only supports en-US.
Modifier events suppressed are SHIFT and both ALT keys. Chrome is not affected.
1337157 - disable WebGL debug renderer info (FF60)
1459089 - disable OS locale in HTTP Accept-Language headers (ANDROID) (FF62)
1479239 - return "no-preference" with prefers-reduced-motion (FF63)
1363508 & 1826051 - spoof/suppress Pointer Events (FF64, FF132)
1492766 - spoof pointerEvent.pointerid (FF65)
1485266 - disable exposure of system colors to CSS or canvas (FF67)
1494034 - return "light" with prefers-color-scheme (FF67)
1564422 - spoof audioContext outputLatency (FF70)
1595823 - return audioContext sampleRate as 44100 (FF72)
1607316 - spoof pointer as coarse and hover as none (ANDROID) (FF74)
1621433 - randomize canvas (previously FF58+ returned an all-white canvas) (FF78)
1506364 - return "no-preference" with prefers-contrast (FF80)
1653987 - limit font visibility to bundled and "Base Fonts" (Windows, Mac, some Linux) (FF80)
1461454 - spoof smooth=true and powerEfficient=false for supported media in MediaCapabilities (FF82)
531915 - use fdlibm's sin, cos and tan in jsmath (FF93, ESR91.1)
1756280 - enforce navigator.pdfViewerEnabled as true and plugins/mimeTypes as hard-coded values (FF100-115)
1692609 - reduce JS timing precision to 16.67ms (previously FF55+ was 100ms) (FF102)
1422237 - return "srgb" with color-gamut (FF110)
1794628 - return "none" with inverted-colors (FF114)
1787790 - normalize system fonts (FF128)
1835987 - spoof timezone as Atlantic/Reykjavik (previously FF55+ was UTC) (FF128)
1834307 - always use smooth scrolling (FF132)
1918202 - spoof screen orientation based on spoofed screen size and platform (FF132)
previously it always returned landscape-primary and an angle of 0 (FF50+)
1390465 - load all subtitles in WebVTT (Video Text Tracks) (FF133)
1873382 - make spoofed devicePixelRatio and CSS media queries match (FF133)
previously FF41+ devicePixelRatio was hardcoded as 1 and FF127+ as 2
previously FF41+ CSS media queries were spoofed as zoom level at a devicePixelRatio of 1

meta.title: OPTIONAL RFP (resistFingerprinting)

meta.NOTE: The P in PB mode can be misleading: it means no "persistent" disk state such as history,
meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>History>Custom Settings>Always use private browsing mode
meta.description:
caches, searches, cookies, localStorage, IndexedDB etc (which you can achieve in normal mode).
In fact, PB mode limits or removes the ability to control some of these, and you need to quit
Firefox to clear them. PB is best used as a one off window (Menu>New Private Window) to provide
a temporary self-contained new session. Close all private windows to clear the PB session.
meta.title: start Firefox in PB (Private Browsing) mode

meta.description: capacity: -1=determine dynamically (default), 0=none, n=memory capacity in kibibytes
meta.title: disable memory cache

meta.NOTE: This does not clear any passwords already saved
meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>Logins and Passwords>Ask to save logins and passwords for websites
meta.title: disable saving passwords

meta.NOTE: This means any permission changes are session only
meta.title: disable permissions manager from writing to disk [FF41+] [RESTART]

meta.NOTE: This affects login/cert/key dbs. The effect is all credentials are session-only.
meta.description: Saved logins and passwords are not available. Reset the pref and restart to return them
meta.title: disable intermediate certificate caching [FF41+] [RESTART]

meta.NOTE: favicons.sqlite is sanitized on Firefox close
meta.description:
actual history (and bookmarks) already do. Your history is more detailed, so
control that instead; e.g. disable history, clear history on exit, use PB mode
meta.title: disable favicons in history and bookmarks
exclude "Undo Closed Tabs" in Session Restore

meta.description: Application data isolation [1]
meta.title: disable "open with" in download dialog [FF50+]

meta.SETTING: Search>Address Bar>When using the address bar, suggest
meta.title: disable location bar suggestion types

meta.description: This value controls the total number of entries to appear in the location bar dropdown
meta.title: disable location bar dropdown

meta.NOTE: We also clear history and downloads on exit (2811)
meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>History>Custom Settings>Remember browsing and download history
meta.title: disable browsing and download history

meta.SETTING: To set your custom default "downloads": General>Downloads>Save files to
meta.description: 0=desktop, 1=downloads (default), 2=custom
meta.title: discourage downloading to desktop

meta.SETTING: Privacy & Security>Forms and Autofill>Autofill addresses
meta.description:
If .supportedCountries includes your region (browser.search.region) and .supported
is "detect" (default), then the UI will show. Stored data is not secure, uses JSON
meta.title: disable Form Autofill
limit events that can cause a pop-up
disable Windows native notifications and use app notications instead [FF111+] [WINDOWS]

meta.NOTE: This does not affect explicit user action such as using search buttons in the
meta.description:
Don't leak URL typos to a search engine, give an error message instead
Examples: "secretplace,com", "secretplace/com", "secretplace com", "secret place.com"
dropdown, or using keyword search shortcuts you configure in options (e.g. "d" for DuckDuckGo)
meta.title: disable location bar using search

meta.description: Disk avoidance, application data isolation, eyeballs...

meta.title: OPTIONAL OPSEC

meta.NOTE: When both Ion and JIT are disabled, and trustedprincipals
meta.description: is enabled, then Ion can still be used by extensions (1599226)
meta.title: disable Ion and baseline JIT to harden against JS exploits [RESTART]

meta.STATS: ~0.2% of websites, about half of which are for cryptomining / malvertising [2][3]
meta.description:
Vulnerabilities [1] have increasingly been found, including those known and fixed
in native programs years ago [2]. WASM has powerful low-level access, making
certain attacks (brute-force) and vulnerabilities more possible
meta.title: disable WebAssembly [FF52+]
disable rendering of SVG OpenType fonts

meta.SETTING: General>DRM Content>Play DRM-controlled content
meta.description: Optionally hide the UI setting which also disables the DRM prompt
meta.title: disable all DRM content (EME: Encryption Media Extension)

meta.NOTE: PHP defaults to IPv6 with "localhost". Use "php -S 127.0.0.1:PORT"
meta.description:
This is an application level fallback. Disabling IPv6 is best done at an OS/network
level, and/or configured properly in system wide VPN setups.
meta.title: disable IPv6 if using a VPN

meta.NOTE: Will cause breakage: older modems/routers and some sites e.g banks, vimeo, icloud, instagram
meta.description: 0=always (default), 1=only if base domains match, 2=only if hosts match
meta.title: control when to send a cross-origin referer

meta.description:
Firefox uses the system DNS to initially resolve the IP address of your DoH server.
When set to a valid, working value that matches your "network.trr.uri" (0712) Firefox
won't use the system DNS. If the IP doesn't match then DoH won't work
meta.title: set DoH bootstrap address [FF89+]

meta.description:
Not recommended. Overriding these can cause breakage and performance issues,
they are mostly fingerprintable, and the threat model is practically nonexistent

meta.title: OPTIONAL HARDENING

meta.WHY: It includes updates for "revoked certificates"
meta.title: enforce Firefox blocklist

meta.WHY: Spoofing can affect CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) protections
meta.title: enforce no referer spoofing
enforce a security delay on some confirmation dialogs such as install, open/save

meta.WARNING: Replaced with network partitioning (FF85+) and TCP (2701), and enabling FPI
meta.description: disables those. FPI is no longer maintained except at Tor Project for Tor Browser's config
meta.title: enforce no First Party Isolation [FF51+]

meta.WHY: To prevent wasting Mozilla's time with a custom setup
meta.description: Web Compatibility Reporter adds a "Report Site Issue" button to send data to Mozilla
meta.title: enforce disabling of Web Compatibility Reporter [FF56+]

meta.WHY: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/quarantined-domains */
meta.title: enforce Quarantined Domains [FF115+]

meta.title: DON'T TOUCH

meta.WHY: The API state is easily fingerprintable.
meta.description:
Location-Aware Browsing, Full Screen
Geo is behind a prompt (7002). Full screen requires user interaction
meta.title: disable APIs

meta.SETTING: to manage site exceptions: Options>Privacy & Security>Permissions>Settings
meta.WHY: These are fingerprintable via Permissions API, except VR. Just add site
meta.description:
Location, Camera, Microphone, Notifications [FF58+] Virtual Reality [FF73+]
0=always ask (default), 1=allow, 2=block
exceptions as allow/block for frequently visited/annoying sites: i.e. not global
meta.title: set default permissions

meta.WHY: Passive fingerprinting. Minimal/non-existent threat of downgrade attacks
meta.title: disable non-modern cipher suites [1]

meta.WHY: Passive fingerprinting and security
meta.title: control TLS versions

meta.WHY: Passive fingerprinting and perf costs. These are session-only
meta.description: and isolated with network partitioning (FF85+) and/or containers
meta.title: disable SSL session IDs [FF36+]

meta.WHY: Only cross-origin referers (1602, 5510) matter
meta.title: referers

meta.WHY: Defaults are fine. They can be overridden by a site-controlled Referrer Policy
meta.description: 0=no-referer, 1=same-origin, 2=strict-origin-when-cross-origin, 3=no-referrer-when-downgrade
meta.title: set the default Referrer Policy [FF59+]

meta.WHY: Already isolated with network partitioning (FF85+)
meta.title: disable HTTP Alternative Services [FF37+]

meta.WHY: Just use Shift-Right-Click
meta.title: disable website control over browser right-click context menu

meta.WHY: Breakage, font fallback is equivalency, also RFP
meta.title: disable icon fonts (glyphs) and local fallback rendering

meta.WHY: Fingerprintable. Breakage. Cut/copy/paste require user
meta.description: interaction, and paste is limited to focused editable fields
meta.title: disable Clipboard API

meta.WHY: It can compromise security. System addons ship with prefs, use those
meta.title: disable System Add-on updates

meta.WHY: DNT is enforced with Tracking Protection which is used in ETP Strict (2701)
meta.title: enable the DNT (Do Not Track) HTTP header

meta.NOTE: FPP (fingerprintingProtection) is ignored when RFP (4501) is enabled
meta.WHY: Arkenfox only supports strict (2701) which sets these at runtime
meta.title: customize ETP settings

meta.WHY: Already isolated with TCP (2701) behind a pref (2710)
meta.title: disable service workers

meta.WHY: Web Notifications are behind a prompt (7002)
meta.title: disable Web Notifications [FF22+]

meta.NOTE: To remove all subscriptions, reset "dom.push.userAgentID"
meta.WHY: Website "push" requires subscription, and the API is required for CRLite (1224)
meta.title: disable Push Notifications [FF44+]

meta.WHY: Firefox desktop uses mDNS hostname obfuscation and the private IP is never exposed until
meta.description: required in TRUSTED scenarios; i.e. after you grant device (microphone or camera) access
meta.title: disable WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication)

meta.WHY: Passive and active fingerprinting. Mostly redundant with Tracking Protection
meta.description: in ETP Strict (2701) and sanitizing on close (2800s)
meta.title: enable GPC (Global Privacy Control) in non-PB windows
